author: The Current
description:
"There is an exact, perfect word for every sentiment," Samia says. 
Support The Current: https://support.mpr.org/youtube 

Singer-songwriter Samia releases her second full-length album, 'Bloodless,' on April 25, 2025. The Current's Jessica Paxton was struck by the expressive, descriptive lyrics in the songs — and Samia responds by talking about her love of the English language. 

Samia’s 2025 album, 'Bloodless,' is available on @grandjurymusic.

Credits
Guest – @samiatheband 
Host – Jessica Paxton
Producer – Derrick Stevens
Audio – Evan Clark
Video – Ruben Schneiderman
Camera Operators – Derek Ramirez, Ruben Schneiderman
Graphics – Natalia Toledo
Digital Producer – Luke Taylor

title: Samia describes fondness for expressive lyrics in her songs #shorts #interview

author: The Current
description:
To celebrate The Current’s 20th Anniversary, The Current’s Live Sessions Vault unlocks never-before-seen live performance videos of bands and artists who have played in our iconic studio. 

Watch to see the full session of Sarah Krueger, featuring previously unreleased footage, from when she visited The Current studio back in 2014.

Songs Performed 
00:00:00 Glory
00:02:40 Nothing Hits Me
00:07:17 Better When You Are Around

Musicians
Sarah Krueger – vocals, guitar
Jordan Taylor — piano
JT Bates — drums
Steve Garrington — bass
Nate Case — guitar
Erik Koskinen — guitar

Credits
Engineer – Mike DeMark
Producer – David Campbell
Visuals  – Nate Ryan
Digital Producer – Natalia Toledo
Graphics – Natalia Toledo

The Current’s Live Sessions Vault is supported by the Minnesota Orchestra, GS Motors, and Delta Dental of Minnesota Foundation.
